intro: Borinda lushuiensis, commonly known as the Lushui borinda, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments within its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
